words.definition: To abolish something means to put an end to it, such as a system or law.
words.example: The government decided to abolish the old tax law.

words.definition: To amend something means to change it to improve it.
words.example: The constitution was amended to include new rights for citizens.

words.definition: To aspire means to have a strong desire to achieve or do something.
words.example: Many young people aspire to be successful doctors.

words.definition: To censor something means to remove parts of it that are considered offensive or harmful.
words.example: The government censored the movie to remove violent scenes.

words.definition: A charter is a formal document that describes the rights and duties of a group.
words.example: The school's charter outlines its goals and rules.

words.definition: A constitution is a set of rules by which a country is governed.
words.example: The country's new constitution was signed by the president.

words.definition: If a place is cosmopolitan, it is full of people from many different countries.
words.example: New York is a very cosmopolitan city with people from all over the world.

words.definition: To disseminate information means to spread it to many people.
words.example: The organization works to disseminate information about health.

words.definition: To flatter someone means to praise them in order to please them.
words.example: He tried to flatter his boss to get a promotion.

words.definition: If someone is infamous, they are well known for something bad.
words.example: The pirate was infamous for his many crimes at sea.

words.definition: If an animal or person is lame, they cannot walk properly because of an injury.
words.example: The horse became lame after it tripped on a rock.

words.definition: To limp means to walk with difficulty because one leg is hurt.
words.example: He had to limp back to the house after he hurt his ankle.

words.definition: An outburst is a sudden strong expression of an emotion.
words.example: Her sudden outburst of anger surprised everyone in the room.

words.definition: If something is pathological, it is related to a disease or is not normal.
words.example: The doctor studied the pathological effects of the virus.

words.definition: If something is phenomenal, it is very great or impressive.
words.example: The young musician's performance was truly phenomenal.

words.definition: A poll is a survey of people's opinions.
words.example: The recent poll shows that most people support the new law.

words.definition: Remorse is a feeling of being sorry for something bad you have done.
words.example: He felt great remorse for the way he had treated his friend.

words.definition: Secrecy is the state of being kept hidden from others.
words.example: The details of the mission were kept in strict secrecy.

words.definition: To tackle a problem means to deal with it in a determined way.
words.example: The government is trying to tackle the issue of unemployment.

words.definition: A trance is a state in which someone is not aware of what is happening around them.
words.example: The magician put the woman into a deep trance.
